concept.title: Channel micro-paths
concept.shortdesc: Micro-paths are the most common paths traveled by customers within a channel. Each micro-path shows the sequence of events that occurred within the channel.

conbody.p: Analyzing the channel micro-paths within a customer path can help you to answer the following types of business questions:

li.p: What were the most common customer behaviors that preceded a milestone customer behavior? What were the most common behaviors that customers exhibited after a milestone event?
What were the most common micro-paths across all of the channels in the customer path? How did customers make the various channel switches within a customer path?

conbody.p: Examining micro-paths can help you to understand how company-initiated events are driving specific customer behaviors. These insights can help customer experience designers to develop the company-initiated events for storyboards in IBM Journey Designer.

You can also easily identify negative customer behaviors, so that you can further investigate possible causes for these behaviors and recommend adjustments to improve the customer experience. Examples of negative behaviors include Cart Abandonment, Rejected Offer, Email Opt Out, and Struggle events.
